questions.question: 1. MIS primarily helps managers by providing:
options: B. Tools and information for informed decisions
D. Training modules for employee onboarding

options: B. Users interacting with the system

options: B. A monthly sales trend report

options: B. Offering timely and relevant information

options: B. Hardware–servers; Software–reporting tools; Data–transactional records

D. Data–procedures; Processes–market trends; Hardware–software applications

1. Which of the following best describes an information system?
options: A. A system designed to collect, process, store, and distribute information
B. A system solely designed for physical document management
C. A system that doesn't require human interaction
D. A system that deals with physical documents only

questions.question: 2. What is the primary purpose of a management information system (MIS)?
options: A. To facilitate communication between employees
C. To analyze historical data for decision-making
D. To track financial transactions in real-time

questions.question: 3. In the context of information retrieval, what does the term "Boolean operators" refer to?
options: A. A method of organizing files in a hierarchical structure
B. Logical operators used to combine search terms
C. A type of database management system
D. A method for storing data in databases

questions.question: 4. Which file organization method allows for direct access to any record in the file based on its key?
5. What is the main advantage of using a sorted file organization?
6. What data structure is commonly used for implementing sorting algorithms?
7. What is the purpose of merging in the context of data processing?
options: A. To split large files into smaller segments
B. To combine multiple sorted files into a single sorted file
C. To convert unstructured data into structured data
D. To retrieve specific information from a database

questions.question: 8. Which sorting algorithm has the best time complexity in the worst-case scenario?
9. In a B-tree data structure, what does the term "order" refer to?
options: B. The total number of nodes in the tree
C. The maximum number of children per node
D. The minimum number of children per node

questions.question: 10. What is the primary purpose of a data node in an AVL tree?
options: B. To enforce data integrity constraints
C. To facilitate efficient data retrieval
D. To reduce the need for data normalization

questions.question: 11. Which file organization method is most suitable for applications requiring sequential access to records?
12. Which of the following is NOT a type of sorting algorithm?
13. In the context of data structures, what is the primary purpose of a stack?
options: A. To store data in a sorted manner
B. To facilitate first-in, first-out (FIFO) access
D. To provide last-in, first-out (LIFO) access

questions.question: 14. Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a well-designed database?
15. What is the primary advantage of using a tree data structure over a linked list?
options: A. Trees allow for faster searching
B. Trees require less memory space
C. Trees can represent hierarchical relationships
D. Trees have constant time complexity for insertion and deletion

questions.question: 16. Which sorting algorithm exhibits a time complexity of O(n log n) on average?
17. Which of the following is a disadvantage of using a heap data structure?
options: A. Efficient retrieval of the minimum or maximum element
B. Dynamic resizing of the underlying array
C. Poor performance for searching operations
D. Constant time complexity for insertion and deletion

questions.question: 18. What is the primary purpose of normalization in database design?
options: B. To organize data into tables and columns
C. To reduce data redundancy and dependency
D. To facilitate efficient sorting operations

20. Which data structure is typically used to implement a priority queue?
